summary:
•	Responsible for day to day planning, execution and reporting standard weekly experimental runs to support the team.
•	Performing (mostly) automated physical and chemical analyses; Assessing and interpreting analysis results; Analyzing standards; 
•	Reporting results and performing various administrative tasks; Perform simple preventive maintenance or first-line troubleshooting on analytical equipment; 
•	Perform control tasks in the field of safety, quality, stock management and continuous improvement; 
•	The use of various assistance systems; When it is necessary for the occupation.
•	Experiments for method development and qualification and data analysis.
•	Prepare reagents and buffers
•	Participate and execute general laboratory tasks and improve laboratory procedures
•	Repair various types of equipment qualitatively and high -quality, whereby personal responsibility, involvement and initiative
•	With a lot of modern and well-maintained equipment, Responsible for analysis such as GC, XRF, FTIR, viscosity, color, residue determination and particle size.
•	Receive, check (and register) the received samples. If necessary, request more information about analysis from manager if the material or analysis is unclear; 
•	Analyze all incoming samples (between 100 and 200 different types of tests); Assess the reality value analysis result; Process results and record your work; Keep an eye on quality and do work to ensure this.
•	Dry, package and ship out samples to clients.
•	Ensuring that all lab equipment is properly operated and maintained.


Self Motivate, Innovative, Positive Thinking, Patience and problem solving

education.degree_name: Masters in chemistry, bachelor of edcation and kindergarten trained.

profile_positions.title: Laboratory Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Volunteering Activities includes
 Assisting the planning and delivery of learning activities.
 Establishing positive relationships with all the children, including those with additional educational needs.
 Supervising children in the class room and other learning areas
 Promoting and safeguarding the welfare of the children
 Evaluating the development and learning of children
 Helping to setup and to maintain a safe learning environment
Lunch time supervision Activities
 Working with young children and with children with special educational needs
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

skills: Able to handle different age groups
